I don't think we should make a copy of flex config here. We should use the flex config in image. if it is not available, then fail the operation.

For the time being, or if the back port was rejected, you can use master image for the experiment.

comments.body: /azp run
Azure Pipelines successfully started running 1 pipeline(s).

1. Should this change be added to playbook of add-topo as well?
2. Is this change persistent across reboot?

> 1. Should this change be added to playbook of add-topo as well?
> 2. Is this change persistent across reboot?

1. Yes, I will add this change into ```add-topo``` when this change is confirmed to be helpful for this issue. Currently, adding it to ```restart-topo``` is the fastest way to roll this change out.
2. No, the change is not persistent after reboot. I will file another PR to persist the parameter into ```/etc/sysctl.conf``` after more verification.
Thanks.

reviews.body:
Test plan covered the positive test cases. Thank you!

However, I think the test plan should also cover the negative test cases. e.g. 128  ciphers should not be able to connect to sonic.

comments.body:
@Xichen96 @yxieca for now reboot cases have been skipped for all platforms which does not have "port_type" in hwsku.json (as of now I do see only 3 which has [port_type](https://github.com/Azure/sonic-buildimage/search?p=1&q=%27port_type%27) or does not have hwsku.json included

As I see from spec [DPB-HLD](https://github.com/Azure/SONiC/blob/master/doc/dynamic-port-breakout/sonic-dynamic-port-breakout-HLD.md) hwsku.json did not include "port_type" as default parameter (in fact there is no port_type parameters available). 

As @Xichen96 mention in PR the goal was downgrade exception to warning but in fact we just expect all of them to fail? 
Could you please provide some additional info why we do check "port_type" and why we should skip all cases if hwsku.json not provided?

Shall the `-it` option be removed for the `docker exec` commands in this list as well?
```
docker_cmds_201911 = [
    "docker exec -it syncd{} saidump",
    "docker stats --no-stream",
    "docker ps -a",
    "docker top pmon",
    "docker exec -it lldp{} lldpcli show statistics",
    "docker logs bgp{}",
    "docker logs swss{}",
]
```
/azp run
Azure Pipelines successfully started running 1 pipeline(s).

Hi @wangxin 
We do not need to remove '-it' option for 201911 branch.
I did this commit based on commit https://github.com/Azure/sonic-mgmt/pull/4409/files from @yxieca which splits logic for latest and 201911 branches. 201911 - will use '-it', but all new will not.
@yxieca This PR break recently show techsupport test case on some platforms, shall we revert it?

Hi, 
We tested this fix on 202106 on different Nvidia(Mellanox) platforms - it pass. On which device it fail, which image?

The issue can be found on 7050/7260 with both the latest 202012 image and master image, also including mlx 4600 with 202012 image, mlx 2700 with master image. Use "docker exec -it syncd{} saidump" rather than "docker exec syncd{} saidump" can fix it.

Hi @yxieca This fix work for 202106 image.
Should we add some IF logic for branch 202012(the same as we have for 201911)?

> Hi @yxieca This fix work for 202106 image. Should we add some IF logic for branch 202012(the same as we have for 201911)?

No need now, it is passed with the latest 202012 image which has already included the two related PRs in the sonic-utilities repo. It should be fine as well with the latest master image.
@yxieca Could you please take a look ?

reviews.body:
Test should first set the NTP configuration to allow or disallow NTP long jump. Then check the behavior to be consistent with the expected behavior.

We know that even though we disabled long jump, the long jump still going to happen. So one test case (allow long jump) should pass, and the other testcase (disallow long jump) should fail (xfail).

As of now I found 2 places where we didn't have full coverage:
1. Multiple interface types
2.All possible match fields in pbh_rule

If you tell me any of the above are not needed for full coverage because it is covered in some way via other testing or implicit means, happy to close this. Otherwise would suggest incorporating these improvements. I won't block the PR on these comments, we can add it as a follow up PR, because this is a large change, but want to note these. 

Once you close out the other open comments, happy to approve.

>

Otherwise would suggest incorporating these improvements. I won't block the PR on these comments, we can add it as a follow up PR, because this is a large change, but want to note these.

If not other comments, please approve.
